radiographic_examinations.findings: Varus deformity of the proximal part of the humerus; erosions involving the scapular neck and proximal part of the humerus.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging of the shoulder
radiographic_examinations.findings: Distension of the glenohumeral joint; well-defined erosions involving the anatomic neck of the humerus; enhancing material encasing the scapular neck and proximal part of the humerus; a 1.5-cm subcutaneous mass over the superolateral aspect of the shoulder.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At five years after the initial presentation, no substantial change was noted.
